Rule: If the occupation is `Professional` or `White-Collar`, the likelihood of earning more than $50k increases.
If the education level is `Prof-school` or `Doctorate`, the likelihood of earning more than $50k increases.
If the number of hours worked per week is significantly higher (e.g., 91 hours), the likelihood of earning more than $50k increases.
The combination of higher education (Prof-school, Doctorate) and a defined occupation (Professional, White-Collar) can outweigh the influence of working fewer hours per week.
Age alone does not determine the income prediction; it is more effective when considered in conjunction with other factors such as education and occupation.
